alert.note: Alert for Floyd (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 5:47PM EST until February 19 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following river in Kentucky... Levisa Fork at Prestonsburg affecting Floyd County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Levisa Fork at Prestonsburg. * WHEN...Until Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Archer Park is inundated. At 27.0 feet, Flood gate is closed to the storm drain system in Prestonsburg. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 PM EST Friday the stage was 29.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 30.3 feet this evening. - Action stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 40.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. The next statement will be issued by Midnight tonight.
